thread.title: Gulf Shores named must-see American destination by Country Living magazine
thread.title_full: Gulf Shores named must-see American destination by Country Living magazine

author: Marc D. Anderson | manderson@al.com
title: Gulf Shores named must-see American destination by Country Living magazine
text:
Mixed in with tourism heavy hitters like the Grand Canyon and Yosemite National Park, Gulf Shores earned a spot on Country Living magazine's "20 Places All Americans Should See Before They Die." 
The Hearst Corp.-published magazine -- with 1.6 million paid subscribers, 115,000 followers on Twitter and 2.3 million likes on Facebook -- said the coastal Alabama city's "superfine sand" rivals "some of the softest beaches in the world." 
Other must-see destinations include Na Pali Coast, Hawaii; Devils Tower, Wyoming; Nantucket, Massachusetts; and the Florida Keys. For a complete listing, visit www.countryliving.com . 
The Birmingham-based lifestyle publication's full description of Gulf Shores said the city "once flew under the radar, but is now becoming a better-known vacation spot." 
"And the appeal is clear: White beaches with superfine sand rival some of the softest beaches in the world. Beyond that, the area offers deep-sea fishing, historic Fort Morgan, and even a zipline."
